title: how to get warranty information w/o a phone number from a supported country
content:
Hi,
I bought a Pixel 3a in the Italian Google Store,
but now I'm not in Italy or in a covered country (Estonia).

My phone has "dead touch zone" and I would like to use the warranty.
I tried to follow the instruction in here 
https://support.google.com/pixelphone/answer/7109524 ,
but I'm asked an Italian phone number which I don't have (anymore).

I turned to the "Made by Google" on Facebook,
besides copy/pasting links they have made the arguments:
-  try again "when you're back in the country of purchase";
- "ask a friend".

As I pointed out that:
- even if I was in Italy, I still don't have an Italian phone number
so I can't follow the instructions anyway;
- even if I ask a friend he/she cannot forward the request without my phone,
or authenticating with my phone.

What if my screen just went black? I could not use the phone
to contact the support, so another way to contact the warranty must exist.

I also tried to contact the Assistance Chat using a VPN,
but besides sending the initial message I'm technically not able to reply.

I really don't know what else to do!

I understand and accept that the warranty have to be used
in the country where the phone is purchased and I'm wiling to
send my phone to Italy (or to Finland, which is closer to me),

but what I don't accept being unable to contact the assistance just
*to have the information needed to send the phone an authorized repairer*
or whatever solution Google plan to adopt.

I really don't know what else to do.

Thank you for reading 'till here,
have a good day.

Francesco
